会見場を後にした俺達は、ＬＯＣの職員に別室へと案内された。\nそこにはすでに２社:
Leaving the press conference, we were shown to another room by a staff member from the LOC.
The people in charge of the two companies were already waiting there.
ふぅ……やっと詳しい話が聞けるのかぁ。: Phew... So we can finally hear the details.
でもこの場にはトリニティ・ジュエルの子たちもいるだろうし、\nあまり突っ込んだ話:
But I'm sure the Trinity Jewel kids are here, too
I don't think they'll talk too much about it.
んー。レイヴェル、にんきもので困る。道ふさがれちゃった。: Hmm. Ravel, I don't know what to do with the carrots. They're blocking the way.
リディア、ファンの子たちは悪くない。\nもっと私達が気を使って別のルートを使うべ:
Lydia, the fangirls aren't bad.
We should have taken a different route more carefully.
別の職員に連れられて、トリニティ・ジュエルの３人が現れた。: The trinity jewel trio appeared, led by another staff member.
ああいや、思えば３人構成なんだなって。\nこっちは５人だからさ。:
Oh, no, now that I think about it, it's a three-person group.
There are five of us here.
テストパイロットの人数差を気にしているなら、問題ない。: As long as she was concerned about the difference in the number of test pilots, there was no problem.
いろいろ考えた結果、無理に５人で数合わせするより、\nこの３人の連携がもっともパ:
After a lot of thought, rather than forcing the five of us to count together,
They had concluded that the coordination between these three would be the most performance-oriented.
（大規模な戦闘や軍団規模の衝突なら、数の差で優れるのは\n大きなアドバンテージに:
(If it's a large-scale battle or a clash on the scale of an army, the difference in numbers is what's superior
It'll give us a huge advantage...)
（でもこの規模なら烏合の衆５人よりも、最適な３人チームのほうが\n強い……少なく:
(But at this scale, the optimal three-person team would be better than the five rabble members
He's strong... At least that's what Ravel seems confident in.)
レイヴェルはね、モデルさん。すごいでしょ。: Ravel's a model. Isn't she amazing?
なるほど、だから立っているだけなのに、\nどこかかっこいい感じがするわけか。:
I see, so that's why she's just standing there,
I guess there's something cool about it.
え、えっと……初対面で、ライバルチームのリーダーを、\nいきなり口説くのは……そ:
U-Umm... On our first meeting, I was the leader of a rival team
Trying to hit on her all of a sudden... Um...
ああ、すまん！ 思わずとっさに出ちゃったんだ！\n失礼なこと言って、悪かった。:
Oh, sorry! I couldn't help but leave right away!
I'm sorry for being so rude.
……%usernameusernameuserna%、だったか。\n随分と変わっ:
..._USERNAME_PLACEHOLDER_XYZ123_, was it?
He seems to have changed quite a bit.
（少し警戒心を持たれてしまっただろうか……）: (I wonder if they've become a little wary of me...)
もう%usernameusernameuserna%さん！\n仲良くする相手、間:
Geez_USERNAME_PLACEHOLDER_XYZ123_san!
You're wrong about who you're trying to get along with!
ち、違いますよ！？ %usernameusernameuserna%さんは、\n:
N-No, that's not it!_USERNAME_PLACEHOLDER_XYZ123_san
I'm Treburg Integrity's personal servant right now!
ちなみにぃ、あたしはすっごくヤキモチ焼いちゃったから、\nあとでお餅焼いてご馳走:
By the way, I got really jealous, so...
I'll bake some mochi and treat you to it later♪ With lots of sugar and kinako mochi!
お前はただ腹減っただけだろ。ドッグフードでも食っとけ。: You're just hungry, aren't you? Eat some dog food.
みなさん、仲が良さそうで何よりです。\nただ……そろそろ話を進めてもいいでしょう:
I'm glad everyone seems to be getting along.
It's just... Is it okay if we move on?
改めて皆さん、先ほどは記者会見お疲れ様でした。\nただいまより今回のプロジェクト:
Everyone, thank you for your hard work at the press conference earlier.
We will now begin the briefing for this project.
……コホン。それではノースリム重工から、\n開発する新型ジェネレーターの方向性に:
...Ahem. Well then, from Northrim Heavy Industries,
I'll explain the direction of the new generator we're developing.
今回のＡＨＤ－５１０は高位域アークプラズマの、\nラミナーフロー維持において誘導:
This time, the ASD-510 was a high-level arc plasma
It is a structure that emphasizes uniformity of guided magnetic bundle density when maintaining laminar flow.
特に、陽極側のデュアルブリッジ・エンハンサーが、\n出力フラット化に寄与しており:
Especially the Dual Bridge Enhancer on the yang pole side
It's contributing to the flattening of the output—
ＶＲＸ－７７の最大の特徴はリアクティブベクトルフィードバックを、\nリアルタイム:
The VRX-77's greatest feature was its reactive vector feedback
I'm doing dynamic modeling in real time!
応答遅延は理論値０．０２秒！: Responding delay is a theoretical value of 0.02 seconds!
マルチレイヤーの位相アルゴリズムがドライバー入力を、\nシンクロナイズして疑似慣:
The multilayered phase algorithm input the screwdriver
Synchronize to correct the pseudo-inertia linearly!
あはは！ だめ、さっぱり分かんないわ！\nいやー、誰か分かりやすく解説できたりす:
Ahaha! No, I don't understand at all!
Man, I wonder if I can explain it in an easy-to-understand way?
あれ？ ロージーさんって結構機械いじりできるよね？\n確かご実家が自動車の整備を:
Huh? Rosie's pretty good at tinkering with machines, isn't she?
If I'm not mistaken, your family runs a car maintenance factory...
構造はある程度わかるけど、スペック的な理論は微妙ね。\nあとあたしって感覚でガチ:
I can understand the structure to some extent, but specs are a little off.
Also, I'm the type to rattle on and on like that, you know?
……たまにメイズとかで私達の機体を応急処置的に見てくれるけど、\nそんな感覚でや:
...Sometimes she'll use her mace to look at our aircraft as first aid, but...
Was that how you felt?
……今度から私はロージーメンテパスで。: ...From now on, I'll be using Rosie Mentepas.
え、えっとえっと……つまりは『ぶいあーるえっくす』は、\nバイブスが上がるってこ:
U-Um, well... In other words, "buia ruekusu" is...
So you're saying the Vibes are going up?!
うん、たぶんそんな感じでいいんじゃない？: Yeah, it's probably fine like that.
エヴィちゃんが言うなら間違いないわね～。: If Eve says so, there's no doubt about it.
……要するにエヴィ以外みんなわからないってことか。\nいや、俺もさっぱりだけど。:
...In other words, no one but Eve knew.
No, I don't have a clue either.
私だって全部を理解してるわけじゃないよ。専門外だし。\nなんとなく自分の引き出し:
I don't understand everything. It's not my area of expertise.
I'm just applying it to my knowledge of drawers and interpreting it.
ずいぶん得意になっているが、\nそちらはアクチュエーター系統のヒートマージンが甘:
I'm pretty good at this, but...
The actuator-type heat margin is too weak for that.
我が社のようにトリプルリザーブ方式を取らねば──: We'll have to use the Triple Reservoir system like our company does.
やだなぁ、そういう『がっちり固める』のはクラシックですよ。\nウチは動的位相制御:
Oh, come on. That kind of 'hardening' is classical music.
We're using dynamic phase control to scatter the heat peak in the first place.
ホントになにを言ってるか、まったくわからない。\n結局どういうことなんだ……？:
I really have no idea what she's saying.
What's going on in the end...?
……ってか、俺たちを置いてけぼりにして\n担当者の人たちヒートアップしてないか？:
...Or rather, he left us behind.
Isn't the people in charge getting heated?
なんですか？ 今、大事なところなんですが！: What is it? It's important right now!
いや、すまん……なにが大事なのかさっぱりわからん。\n多分、ここにいる誰もが。:
No, sorry... I have no idea what's important.
Probably everyone here.
あの意味不明なバトルに割って入るなんて、\n後輩クンってばやるじゃない♪:
Interrupting that cryptic battle...
You're pretty good, Kouhai-kun♪
確かにヒートが……いや、その通りだよなぁ。\nトリプルリザーブ方式じゃない方法も:
Heat is definitely... No, he's right.
There's a way that's not a triple reservoir!
何ですか急に。知ったような顔をしないでください。: What's this all of a sudden? Don't act like you know me.
そんなこと言われても、\n意味わからない話を始めたのはそっちだろ……:
Even if you say that,
You're the one who started this incomprehensible conversation...
ありがとうございます……\n理解できなさすぎて、そろそろ気を失いそうでした……:
Thank you very much...
I was so incomprehensible that I felt like I was about to pass out...
とにかく！\nどういうことなのか全員に分かるように説明してくれないか？:
Anyway!
Can you explain to everyone what's going on?
我が社のＡＨＤはどこまでも出力の伸びるジェネレーターだ。\n立ち上がりはやや重い:
Our company's ASD is a generator that can output as much power as it wants.
It was a bit heavy to stand up, but no matter the situation, it could be stable and squeeze out its power.
……どのようなものだろうと、関係ない。\n私達なら問題なく、乗りこなせる。:
...It doesn't matter what it is.
We'll be able to ride it without any problems.
私たちのＶＲＸは操作に対する機敏な反応が強みです。\n人馬一体とも言うべき操作感:
Our VRX is good at reacting nimbly to manipulation.
I think you'll be able to get a sense of manipulation that can be called human and horse alike.
へえ～！ いいですね！\n作戦もそれに合わせたアゲアゲなものを考えたいですね～！:
Wow! That's great!
I'd like to come up with a plan to match that!
最初からそう言ってくれよ……: You should've told me that from the start...
コ、コホン。さて、仕様に関しての説明会も終わりましたので……\n今後についてお知:
A-Ahem. Now then, the briefing on the specs is over...
I'll let you know what to do next.
両チームのテストパイロットは、\nまず新型ジェネレーターを使用しての訓練を開始し:
The test pilots on both teams...
Please begin training using the new generator.
一週間後の『機動性能評価試験』を皮切りに『戦闘性能評価試験』、\n『メイズ内実地:
Starting with the "Mobility Performance Appraisal" test a week from now, the 'Battle Performance Appraise Test'
We will now conduct the three stages of the Mayse Internal Field Test.
一週間で新型ジェネレーターをモノにしろ、ってことか。: So you're telling me to make the new generator my thing in a week?
おけまるです！ フルートたちなら余裕ですよ～！: We'll be fine! We've got plenty of flutes to play!
両チームは、それぞれ担当のエンジニアチームと協力して、\n評価試験に備えてくださ:
Both teams worked together with the engineering teams in charge
Please prepare for the evaluation exam.
以上でブリーフィングは終わりです。では、解散。: That concludes the briefing. Well then, disband.
担当者の声を合図に、部屋にいたメンバーが続々と席を立つ。\nそんな中、フルートは:
At the voice of the person in charge, the members in the room rose from their seats one after another.
Meanwhile, the flute walked over to Ravel.
トリニティ・ジュエルの皆さんっ！ 改めてよろしくぽよ～！\nアゲアゲでがんばって:
Trinity Jewels! Nice to meet you all again!
Let's do our best with Ageage!
……がんばる？ これを学園行事とでも勘違いしているのか？: ...Do your best? Do you think this is a school event?
巨額の資金が投下された一大プロジェクト、\nそれもＭＧの命とも言うべきジェネレー:
A big project where a huge amount of money was invested,
That was also the "selection" of the MG's life-form generator.
私達に課せられたのは勝利。\nこれ以上馴れ合うつもりはない。:
What was imposed on us was victory.
I had no intention of getting any closer to her.
でも、彼女の言っていることは正論だ。\nきっとフルートもそれはわかってると思う。:
But what she was saying was sound.
I'm sure the flute understands that.
その証拠にフルートの笑顔の裏には強い光が宿っている。: As proof, there was a strong light behind the flute's smile.
もちろん、フルートたちだって負けるつもりはありませんよ～！\nガチで勝利をつかみ:
Of course, the flutes have no intention of losing either!
I'm really going to win!
もっとバチバチと対立してくれてもいいぞ。\nそのほうが互いに研鑽しあうことになる:
You can stand in opposition to me even more.
That way, we'll be able to study together!
フルートにチームの雰囲気づくりをさせる: Make the flute feel like a team.
エヴィにトリニティ・ジュエルの情報収集を指示する: I'll instruct Eve to gather information on Trinity Jewel.
……さて、レイヴェルたちも去ったことだし、\nこれで方針の話ができるな。:
...Now that Ravel and the others have left,
Now we can talk about our plan.
フルートのバイタリティはこのチームに不可欠だ。\nまず全員が前向きに取り組めるよ:
Flute vitality is vital to this team.
First, I'll ask you to create an atmosphere where everyone can be positive.
まかせてください～！\n雰囲気はぽよぽよなフルートが得意なやつですから！:
Leave it to me!
The atmosphere is that of someone who's good at playing the soft flute!
みんなのバイブス、アゲアゲにしちゃいますよ～！: I'll turn everyone's vibrators into Ageage!
まずは敵を知ることが重要だ。: It's important to know the enemy first.
エヴィには、トリニティ・ジュエルの情報をできるだけ集め、\nそして分析してもらい:
To Eve, I gathered as much information as I could about Trinity Jewel
And I want you to analyze it.
オッケー。こっちで拾えるだけ情報をかき集めておくよ。: Okay. I'll gather as much information as I can.
この勝負、勝つぞ。: I'm going to win this match.
当然です！ だって、トレブルクインテットは最強ですから！: Of course! After all, Treburg Integrity is the strongest!
